title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Rhode Island SPCA rescued 97 cats from a hoarding situation in a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket.
Some cats have illnesses and require vet care; others are pregnant and need behavioral assessments.
RISPCA is seeking donations to cover medical and supply costs through their wishlist or digital payment platforms.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran, 29, could see more reps at DH with the Red Sox due to outfield competition.
Duran has not received official word on serving as primary DH but remains open to team needs.
Mentioned in trade rumors, Duran remains unfazed and focuses on improving from his 2025 season.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Jordan Harris is spearheading inclusivity in hockey through his outreach program, Harris' Huskies, in partnership with SCORE Boston.
SCORE Boston provides underprivileged youth with equipment and ice time to make hockey more accessible, supported by multiple organizations.
Harris is actively involved in the NHL Player Inclusion Coalition, emphasizing accessibility and diversity to broaden hockey participation.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return to play for the Celtics around March 1 or March 6, per Bill Simmons.
A 90-second trailer for "The Quiet Work" docuseries about Tatum aired during the NBA All-Star Game.
Tatum recently participated in full 5-on-5 practice sessions and aims to be fully healthy before returning.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A State Police trooper was injured when a vehicle hit his cruiser on I-95 South in Salisbury.
The trooper was released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital and is recovering at home after the accident.
Lawrence resident Josue Levi Cuevas Santana will face charges including negligent operation and using a mobile device while driving.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record with three shutouts in women's hockey at 2026 Winter Olympics.
Team USA defeats Sweden 5-0 in semifinals, advancing to gold-medal game against Canada.
Frankel posts a .985 save percentage, key in Team USA's five consecutive shutout victories.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on February 14, officials say.
Her husband remains missing despite an extensive search involving divers and drones that was suspended until daylight.
The couple fell through the ice while walking their dog, which was found and returned to family members.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded to the San Francisco Giants in June 2025 after disagreements with the Red Sox.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment over Devers' refusal to play first base during an injury crisis.
Devers resisted position changes after Alex Bregman joined, leading to strife with Red Sox and eventual trade.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox President Sam Kennedy rejected claims that the team lacks passion for winning, citing their $256.1 million payroll.
Kennedy admitted the team could have managed Rafael Devers' situation better before his midseason trade to San Francisco.
Alex Bregman signed with the Cubs after the Red Sox didn't meet his demands, including a no-trade clause in contract negotiations.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, were killed and three others injured during a hockey game at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket.
Pawtucket Mayor Donald Grebien stated the shooting was a "targeted family dispute" involving the shooter and relatives.
Shooter identified as Robert Dorgan; authorities confirmed the shooting as self-inflicted and related victims as adults.
